snippet: Lawmakers approved a bill that says state and local governments cannot put a substantial burden on religious practices, a measure that prompted debate about possible discrimination.
abstract: Mississippi lawmakers pass final version of a bill that says state and local governments cannot put a substantial burden on religious practices, measure that prompted debate about possible discrimination against gay people and other groups.
lead_paragraph: Lawmakers approved a bill that says state and local governments cannot put a substantial burden on religious practices, a measure that prompted debate about possible discrimination.

headline.main: Mississippi: Bill to Shield Religious Practices Passes
